drills.title: Passing Squares
drills.description: A basic soccer passing drill used mainly with younger and beginner players. The square is contained and helps players visualize where they should pass and move to.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Create a square (20x20 yards) using cones. If working with younger players, reduce to 15x15 yards. Position one player on each corner of the square with two players on the cone where the ball starts.

HOW TO PLAY:
1. Players start by passing the ball around the square in a clockwise or counterclockwise direction.
2. After passing, players must immediately move to the next cone in a counterclockwise direction.
3. The next player on the receiving end must check their shoulder, receive the ball with the inside of their foot, and pass it to the next player.
4. As players become comfortable, add a second ball to increase the difficulty and tempo.
5. To further challenge players, introduce a defender in the middle of the square who tries to intercept passes.

COACHING POINTS:
- Pass with Purpose: Focus on weight and accuracy of passes, aiming for teammate's preferred foot.
- Quick Transitions: After making a pass, immediately move to the next cone.
- Body Positioning: Receive the ball with body open to the field.
- Head Up: Keep heads up before receiving to scan the field.

EQUIPMENT: 4 cones, 2 balls, training bibs

drills.title: Triangle Passing Drill
drills.description: Simple passing drill perfect for U6, U8 and U10 players.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Create a triangle using 3 cones. Players stand at each corner.

HOW TO PLAY:
1. Player A passes to player B
2. Player B passes to player C
3. Player C passes back to player A
4. After passing, each player moves to the next position in the triangle
5. Continue pattern for set time

COACHING POINTS:
- Use inside of foot for passing
- Non-passing foot should point toward target
- Passes should be on the ground
- Communicate with teammates

drills.title: Jackpot Passing Drill
drills.description: Fun passing drill where players race to knock a ball off a cone.
drills.instructions:
SET UP: Set up a 16x16 yard diamond with tall cones. In the center, place a small cone on the ground with a ball on top. Place 1 ball behind each of the tall cones on the outside of the diamond.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Split players into 4 teams and have them line up behind each tall cone.
2. On coach's call, the first player from each line runs anti-clockwise around the diamond.
3. When they return, they take a setup touch and make a pass to knock the central ball off its cone.
4. If anyone succeeds, they shout 'Jackpot' and win a point.
5. Repeat with next players.

PROGRESSION: Play is continuous - as soon as player returns and passes, next player runs.

COACHING POINTS:
- A (Approach): Approach ball at an angle
- B (Balance): Standing foot next to ball, balance forward
- C (Contact): Hit center of ball with inside of foot

drills.title: T-Cone Dribbling Drill
drills.description: Great drill to focus on dribbling with speed, controlled touches, turns, and fitness.
drills.instructions:
SETUP:
1. Set up four cones approximately 5 yards apart in the shape of the letter T.
2. Two players at the T-cones with one ball at the base of the T.
3. Create multiple T-cone setups for entire team.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Player starts at T's base and dribbles around the middle-top cone, cuts to the right-top cone.
2. Dribbles around right-top cone and cuts towards top-left cone.
3. Dribbles around middle-top cone and returns to starting cone.
4. Dribbles around bottom cone and continues same pattern.
5. Repeat for 1 minute, then rotate players.

VARIATIONS:
- Limit to right foot only
- Limit to left foot only
- Use bottom of foot only
- No ball - sprint only

COACHING POINTS:
- Close touches
- Dribble with speed
- Tight turns around cones

drills.title: Cone Maze Dribbling
drills.description: Technical cone maze for kids to improve dribbling skills.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Set up cones in a maze pattern with gates for players to dribble through.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Players line up at start of maze
2. First player dribbles through cones following the path
3. Player must navigate around cones without hitting them
4. At the end, player turns and returns via different route
5. Next player goes when previous player reaches middle

COACHING POINTS:
- Keep ball close to feet
- Use both feet
- Head up to see path
- Change of direction should be smooth

drills.title: Dribbling at the Cone
drills.description: Youth soccer dribbling drill for ball control.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Place a single cone in center of area with players lined up with balls.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. First player dribbles toward cone
2. At cone, player performs a turn or move
3. Player dribbles back to starting position
4. Next player goes

COACHING POINTS:
- Ball close to cone
- Sharp turns
- Keep head up
- Use different turns/moves

drills.title: Zig-Zag Dribbling Drill
drills.description: The Zig-Zag soccer dribbling drill for improving ball control.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Set up 5-6 cones in a zig-zag pattern about 3-4 yards apart.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Player starts at first cone
2. Dribbles to second cone, weaves around it
3. Continues to each cone in pattern
4. At end, player turns and dribbles back through cones
5. Repeat for specified time

COACHING POINTS:
- Keep touches light
- Close control around cones
- Accelerate out of turns
- Use both feet

drills.title: 4 Gate Drill
drills.description: The 4 Gate Drill for Developing Agility and Dribbling Skills.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Set up 4 cones to create 2 gates (about 3 yards apart).

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Player starts behind first gate
2. Dribbles through gate, accelerates to second gate
3. Dribbles through second gate
4. Player turns and dribbles back through gates
5. Time each run, try to beat best time

VARIATIONS:
- Use only right foot
- Use only left foot
- Add defender

COACHING POINTS:
- Head up
- Close control in gates
- Quick acceleration between gates

drills.title: Lightning Shooting Drill
drills.description: Fast-paced shooting game where players compete to be last one standing.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: One player is goalkeeper. Others line up 12-18 yards from goal. Coach stands next to goal with balls.

HOW TO PLAY:
1. Coach passes ball to first player in line
2. Player must attempt goal with first touch

IF PLAYER SCORES:
- They return to back of line
- Goalkeeper is eliminated
- Next player becomes new goalkeeper

IF PLAYER DOESN'T SCORE:
- Goalkeeper moves to end of line
- Missed shooter becomes new goalkeeper

Once eliminated, players stand behind goal to collect balls. If they catch a missed shot before it hits ground, they rejoin. Last player remaining wins!

COACHING POINTS:
- First touch to goal
- Shot placement over power
- Quick transitions

drills.title: Numbers Shooting
drills.description: Fun finishing game with 2v2 matches.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: 24x20 yard grid with two regular-sized goals. Players divided into two teams with numbers.

HOW TO PLAY:
1. Coach throws ball into play and calls two numbers
2. Called players from each team dash onto field through their assigned goal
3. Play 2v2 until ball leaves or goal scored
4. Coach immediately calls two new numbers
5. Continue for predetermined time

COACHING POINTS:
- Quick decision making
- Communication between teammates
- Composure in front of goal

drills.title: 2v1 To Goal
drills.description: Simple finishing game with attacker vs defender scenarios.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: 30x25 yard grid with large goal at one end, small goal at other.

HOW TO PLAY:
1. Red player passes to blue player at front of line
2. Two blue players attack large goal
3. Red player who made pass defends the goal
4. If red retrieves ball, they attack small goal
5. Next players repeat after ball goes out or goal scored

COACHING POINTS:
- Quick shots
- Good angle of approach
- Defending: force to outside

drills.title: Multi-ball Shooting
drills.description: Exciting small-sided game with many balls in play.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: 35x25 yard grid with two goals. Distribute 12-16 balls around perimeter.

HOW TO PLAY:
1. Standard soccer rules apply
2. When goal scored or ball leaves, non-offending team restarts with any ball on perimeter
3. Only ONE ball on field at a time
4. If second ball introduced, opposing team gets free kick
5. Game ends when all balls used

COACHING POINTS:
- First touch
- Vision and awareness
- Quick shots

drills.title: Goalkeeper Side-to-Side
drills.description: Goalkeeper drill for footwork and positioning.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Goalkeeper stands in goal with coach or server 15-20 yards away with ball.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Coach rolls ball to goalkeeper's right
2. Goalkeeper shuffles side-to-side to catch/collect ball
3. Coach rolls ball to goalkeeper's left
4. Goalkeeper shuffles to other side
5. Continue alternating sides

VARIATIONS:
- Add throws from different angles
- Add catching at different heights

COACHING POINTS:
- Stay low
- Quick footwork
- Watch the ball all the way

drills.title: Goalkeeper Shooting Angle
drills.description: Goalkeeper drill for understanding angles.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Goalkeeper in goal. Server 25-30 yards away with balls.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Server shoots from various positions
2. Goalkeeper learns to cut down angle
3. Server starts shooting faster
4. Goalkeeper practices coming out to meet shots

COACHING POINTS:
- Take correct starting position
- Read the shooter's body
- Make yourself big

drills.title: Goalkeeper Down Up Drill
drills.description: Basic goalkeeper footwork drill.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Goalkeeper stands in front of goal. Coach with ball 10 yards away.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Coach rolls ball along ground toward goalkeeper
2. Goalkeeper drops to knee and collects ball
3. Coach rolls ball to other side
4. Goalkeeper rolls to other knee and collects
5. Continue alternating

COACHING POINTS:
- Control the ball
- Protect body
- Quick recovery

drills.title: 1v1 Defending
drills.description: Practice 1v1 defending skills.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: 20x20 yard area with goal at one end. Defender and attacker at start line.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Attacker tries to dribble past defender to goal
2. Defender tries to stop attacker
3. If defender wins ball, they become attacker
4. Rotate roles after each attempt

COACHING POINTS:
- Stay low
- Don't commit too early
- Force attacker to weak foot
- Watch the ball

drills.title: 1v1 Attacking and Reaction
drills.description: 1v1 drill focusing on attacking skills.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: 30x40 yard area with goals at each end. Players in pairs.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Player A dribbles toward player B
2. Player B defends
3. After initial contact, coach shouts 'freeze' randomly
4. Players must react to stop immediately
5. Resume and play to goal

COACHING POINTS:
- Attack with pace
- Sell dummy/move
- Protect the ball

drills.title: 1v1 Progression
drills.description: 1 on 1 soccer progression drill.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: 15x25 yard area with cones marking start/finish lines.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Attacker starts with ball at feet
2. Defender stands 5 yards ahead
3. On signal, attacker tries to get past defender
4. Defender tries to stop attacker
5. If attacker gets past, they shoot on goal

PROGRESSION:
- Start from different angles
- Add second defender after success

COACHING POINTS:
- Attack with speed
- Change of direction
- Defend with patience

drills.title: 1v1 Challenge Circle
drills.description: Circle-based 1v1 drill.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Circle with 10-15 yard diameter. Two players inside with ball.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Attacker tries to dribble across circle
2. Defender tries to win ball
3. If defender wins, roles switch
4. Stay within circle

COACHING POINTS:
- Keep ball close
- Change direction quickly
- Be patient defending

drills.title: Fun Soccer Dribbling Warm-up
drills.description: Fun soccer dribbling warm-up drill.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: 20x20 yard area with all players having balls.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Players dribble freely in area
2. On coach's command, perform different moves:
   - Stop ball with sole
   - Change direction
   - Use weaker foot
3. Continue for set time

COACHING POINTS:
- Keep ball close
- Head up
- Use both feet

drills.title: Bumper Balls
drills.description: Fun soccer game where athletes keep ball in play.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Small area with all players and one ball.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Players try to keep their ball in area
2. If ball goes out, player does 5 jumping jacks
3. Player returns to game
4. Last player with ball in area wins

VARIATIONS:
- Dribble only, no kicking
- Use hands for younger kids

COACHING POINTS:
- Keep ball close
- Stay aware of boundaries

drills.title: Agility Ladder Drills
drills.description: Speed Training for Soccer: Agility Ladder Drills.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Agility ladder laid flat on ground.

DRILL 1 - In and Out:
1. Stand at end of ladder
2. Step both feet in, then out
3. Move forward, repeat down ladder

DRILL 2 - Lateral Shuffle:
1. Face ladder sideways
2. Shuffle right foot in, left foot in
3. Shuffle right foot out, left foot out
4. Continue down ladder

DRILL 3 - Ickey Shuffle:
1. Face forward
2. Right foot in, left foot in
3. Right foot to side
4. Left foot to side
5. Repeat pattern

COACHING POINTS:
- Quick feet
- Stay on toes
- Low center of gravity

drills.title: Speed and Agility Cone Drills
drills.description: Best Agility Cone Drills for Soccer.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: 5 cones in a line, 5 yards apart.

DRILL 1 - 5-10-5:
1. Start at middle cone
2. Sprint to right cone
3. Change direction, sprint to left cone
4. Change direction, sprint through middle

DRILL 2 - Pro Shuttle:
1. Start at first cone
2. Sprint to second cone, touch it
3. Sprint to third cone, touch it
4. Backpedal to start

DRILL 3 - W Drill:
1. Start at bottom
2. Sprint to right cone
3. Cut to middle cone
4. Sprint to left cone
5. Sprint back through start

COACHING POINTS:
- Quick change of direction
- Stay low
- Full effort each rep

drills.title: Short Passing Drill
drills.description: Youth soccer pass and move drills involving quick passing.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Pairs of players 10-15 yards apart.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Player A passes to player B
2. Player B passes back to player A
3. Players move forward after each pass
4. Continue to end of area
5. Return walking

COACHING POINTS:
- Pass with inside of foot
- Non-passing foot points to target
- Passes on ground
- Communicate

drills.title: Partner Passing
drills.description: Basic soccer partner passing training drill.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Partners facing each other 10-15 feet apart.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Player 1 passes to partner
2. Partner receives and passes back
3. Continue for 1 minute
4. Switch to other foot

COACHING POINTS:
- Lock ankle on passing foot
- Receive with surface of foot
- Passes should be firm but controllable

drills.title: Passing and Movement
drills.description: FIFA drill for passing and movement.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: 30x20 yard area with 3 lines of players.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Passer plays ball to cone
2. Runner makes run around cone
3. Passer plays through ball to runner
4. Runner receives and plays back
5. Rotate positions

COACHING POINTS:
- Timing of run
- Weight of pass
- First touch

drills.title: Perfect the Pass
drills.description: FIFA training for ages 4-8.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Pairs of players with one ball between them.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Players pass to each other
2. Focus on technique
3. Use inside of foot
4. Keep passes on ground

COACHING POINTS:
- Ankle locked
- Non-kicking foot beside ball
- Follow through toward target

drills.title: Receiving Between the Lines
drills.description: FIFA drill for receiving between defensive lines.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Two lines of defenders facing two lines of attackers.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Server plays ball into space between lines
2. Attacker makes run to receive
3. Defender attempts to intercept
4. If received, attacker plays back to server

COACHING POINTS:
- Check shoulder before receiving
- Angle of run
- First touch to set up next action

drills.title: Unopposed Lofted and Driven Passing
drills.description: Practice lofted and driven passing techniques.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Pairs of players 20-30 yards apart.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Player A plays driven pass to player B
2. Player B controls and plays driven pass back
3. Repeat for 1 minute
4. Switch to lofted passes

COACHING POINTS:
- Driven: Strike center of ball with laces
- Lofted: Chip ball with instep
- Passes should reach teammate

drills.title: Dribbling Through Cones
drills.description: Dribbling skill through cone mazes.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Create cone mazes or paths with cones.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Player dribbles through maze
2. Navigate around cones without hitting them
3. Can add turns at cone intersections
4. Race against other players

COACHING POINTS:
- Ball close to feet
- Use both feet
- Keep head up

drills.title: Two Finishes
drills.description: Drill for developing shooting accuracy.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Server with balls at edge of penalty area. Goal with goalkeeper.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Server plays ball to first attacker
2. First attacker takes first touch and shoots
3. Server plays second ball to second attacker
4. Second attacker must volley first time
5. Rotate roles

COACHING POINTS:
- First shot: placement
- Volley: contact ball in air
- Follow through

drills.title: Spin and Finish
drills.description: Soccer shooting drill with turn.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Cone 10 yards from goal with server and balls.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Server passes to cone
2. Attacker runs around cone
3. Receives ball and spins away from defender
4. Takes shot on goal

COACHING POINTS:
- Timing of run
- Clean first touch
- Shot placement

drills.title: Developing Shooting Skills
drills.description: FIFA guide for developing shooting skills ages 4-8.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Players in pairs 15 yards from goal with goalkeeper.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. First player dribbles and shoots
2. Goalkeeper tries to save
3. After shot, player becomes goalkeeper
4. Next player shoots

COACHING POINTS:
- Approach ball at angle
- Non-kicking foot beside ball
- Laces for power
- Follow through

drills.title: Basic Goalkeeper Training
drills.description: Basic goalkeeper training footwork and positioning.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Goalkeeper in goal area with coach.

FOOTWORK DRILL:
1. Coach calls numbers
2. Goalkeeper shuffles to position
3. Start low, go higher on command

POSITIONING DRILL:
1. Coach shoots from different angles
2. Goalkeeper learns to cut angles
3. Practice coming off line

COACHING POINTS:
- Stay on toes
- Read the shooter
- Take good angle

drills.title: U7 Goalkeeping Drill
drills.description: U7 goalkeeping soccer drill for beginners.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Small goal or cones. One player is goalkeeper.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Coach rolls ball toward goal
2. Goalkeeper tries to collect
3. Coach then throws in air
4. Goalkeeper catches
5. Switch roles frequently

COACHING POINTS:
- Hands ready
- Watch ball all way
- Fun atmosphere

drills.title: Goalkeeper Reaction Drills
drills.description: Soccer goalie reaction drills for beginners.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Goalkeeper in goal. Coach 15 yards away with ball.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Coach throws ball at random spots
2. Goalkeeper reacts and catches
3. Start slow, increase speed
4. Change height of throws

COACHING POINTS:
- React quickly
- Track ball into hands
- Stay focused

drills.title: Fun Warm Up Soccer Drills
drills.description: 5 Fun Warm Up Soccer Drills for Youth Soccer Practice.
drills.instructions:
WARM UP 1 - Shark and Minnows:
1. One player is shark
2. Others are minnows with balls
3. Minnows dribble, shark tries to tag
4. If tagged, become shark

WARM UP 2 - Red Light Green Light:
1. Dribble forward on green light
2. Stop on red light
3. Loser does exercise

WARM UP 3 - Keep Away:
1. 3-4 players in middle
2. Others outside with balls
3. Outside players try to pass to middle
4. Middle tries to intercept

COACHING POINTS:
- Keep moving
- Stay warm
- Have fun

drills.title: Fun Soccer Warm Up Games
drills.description: 7 Super Fun Soccer Warm Up Games For Kids.
drills.instructions:
GAME 1 - Octopus:
1. One player is 'it' (octopus)
2. Others dribble across field
3. Tagged players become seaweed (static)
4. Last one free wins

GAME 2 - Freeze Tag:
1. One tagger
2. Tagged players freeze
3. Others can unfreeze by passing

GAME 3 - Pac Man:
1. One player is Pac Man
2. Others are ghosts
3. Pac Man eats ghosts by touching

COACHING POINTS:
- Keep it fun
- All get equal activity
- Safety first

drills.title: Agility Training for Better Ball Control
drills.description: FIFA agility training for ages 4-8.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Cones in various patterns.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Players dribble through cones
2. Add changes of direction
3. Increase speed gradually
4. Use both feet

COACHING POINTS:
- Quick feet
- Ball close to cones
- Head up

drills.title: Soccer Agility Circuit
drills.description: Agility circuit training for soccer.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: 4-5 stations set up around field.

STATIONS:
1. Ladder runs
2. Cone slalom
3. Hurdle jumps
4. Shuttle runs
5. Ball dribbling

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Players rotate every 60 seconds
2. Rest 30 seconds between stations
3. Complete 3 rounds

COACHING POINTS:
- Full effort
- Proper technique
- Stay focused

drills.title: Soccer Agility Drills
drills.description: 9 Soccer Agility Drills for improving quickness.
drills.instructions:
DRILL 1 - Lateral Bounds:
1. Stand sideways to cones
2. Bound laterally over each cone
3. Land on both feet

DRILL 2 - T-Drill:
1. Start at base
2. Sprint to top, touch
3. Shuffle to right, touch
4. Shuffle to left, touch
5. Backpedal to start

DRILL 3 - Box Drill:
1. Sprint to corner
2. Shuffle to next
3. Backpedal to next
4. Shuffle to start

COACHING POINTS:
- Low center of gravity
- Quick changes
- Land softly

drills.title: Youth Soccer Defense Drills
drills.description: Top 17 Youth Soccer Defense Drills.
drills.instructions:
DRILL 1 - Shadow Defending:
1. Attacker dribbles
2. Defender shadows without tackling
3. Learn movements

DRILL 2 - Rondo Defense:
1. 4v1 keep away
2. Defender learns to pressure
3. Rotate defenders

DRILL 3 - Team Defensive Shape:
1. Team in defensive formation
2. Coach points to threats
3. Team adjusts shape

COACHING POINTS:
- Stay goal side
- Communicate
- Delay attacker

drills.title: Soccer Finishing Drills
drills.description: 10 Effective Soccer Finishing Drills For Kids.
drills.instructions:
DRILL 1 - Lightning:
1. One goalkeeper, rest in line
2. Coach serves ball
3. Player shoots first touch
4. If score, goalkeeper out

DRILL 2 - Team Lightning:
1. Teams on each side of goal
2. Pass A-B-C triangle
3. C takes shot
4. Points for goals

DRILL 3 - 4v2 to Goal:
1. Attackers in box with server
2. 4 attackers vs 2 defenders
3. 4 passes required before shot

COACHING POINTS:
- First touch to goal
- Shot placement
- Composure

drills.title: Small-Sided Shooting and Finishing Game
drills.description: Small-sided shooting and finishing game.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: 30x20 yard grid with goal at one end.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. 3v3 game in grid
2. Teams score by shooting on goal
3. Defenders try to block shots
4. Ball restarts from coach after goal/out

COACHING POINTS:
- Shoot on sight
- Create space
- Support shooter

drills.title: 1v1 Defending the Dribble
drills.description: 1v1 defending the dribble drill.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: 20x20 yard area with goal. Two lines of players.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Attacker dribbles at defender
2. Defender forces to weak side
3. If defender wins, they become attacker
4. Switch sides

COACHING POINTS:
- Don't overcommit
- Force wide
- Stay low

drills.title: 1v1 Ladder
drills.description: 1v1 ladder drill.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Cones in ladder pattern. Two players at start.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. First pair sprints to first cone
2. At cone, they play 1v1
3. Winner advances to next cone
4. Continue to goal

COACHING POINTS:
- Sprint to cone
- Play quickly
- Win your duel

drills.title: 1v1 to Single Goal
drills.description: 1v1 to single goal drill.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: 25x25 yard area with one goal.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Player A serves to player B
2. Player B attacks goal
3. Player A defends
4. After shot or goal, next pair goes

COACHING POINTS:
- Attack with purpose
- Take shot early
- Defend the goal

drills.title: Soccer Warm Up Drills
drills.description: Fun and effective soccer warm up drills.
drills.instructions:
WARM UP 1 - Gates:
1. Players dribble through gates
2. Count successful gates
3. Try to beat score

WARM UP 2 - Pinnie Chase:
1. Half players wear pinnies
2. Tag those without
3. Switch roles

WARM UP 3 - Gate Keepers:
1. Two players at each gate
2. Players dribble through gates
3. Gate keepers try to tag

COACHING POINTS:
- Stay moving
- Include everyone
- Fun first

drills.title: Goalkeeper Arc Drill
drills.description: Goalkeeper arc drill.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Cones in arc in front of goal. Server with ball.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Goalkeeper starts on line
2. Coach serves ball along arc
3. Goalkeeper moves to each position
4. Collects ball at each spot

COACHING POINTS:
- Read the flight
- Move efficiently
- Secure the ball

drills.title: Goalkeeper Footwork: Scooping Ground Balls
drills.description: Goalkeeper footwork exercise for scooping.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Goalkeeper in ready position. Coach rolls balls.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Coach rolls ball to goalkeeper's right
2. Goalkeeper bends, scoops with both hands
3. Coach rolls to left
4. Goalkeeper scoops from other side

COACHING POINTS:
- Get body behind ball
- Eyes on ball
- Secure catch

drills.title: Attack the Cone Dribbling
drills.description: Attack the cone dribbling skills.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Tall cone in center of area with attacker and defender.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Attacker dribbles around cone
2. Defender tries to win ball
3. If attacker gets past, they score
4. Roles switch

COACHING POINTS:
- Sell the move
- Use body to protect
- Quick feet

drills.title: 1v1 Soccer Drill for Kids
drills.description: 1v1 soccer drill for kids.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: 20x20 yard area with goal. Two lines.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. First player in each line
2. Player with ball attacks
3. Other player defends
4. After goal or ball out, next pair

COACHING POINTS:
- Attack at pace
- Don't give up
- Good sportsmanship

drills.title: Cone Sole Roll Dribbling
drills.description: Cone sole roll dribbling exercise.
drills.instructions:
SETUP: Cones in line. Player with ball.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Player dribbles to first cone
2. Uses sole to roll ball around cone
3. Continues down line
4. Return with other foot

COACHING POINTS:
- Ball under control
- Smooth sole rolls
- Both feet
